problem.p: A mass sits on a frictionless table. It is attached to a wall by a spring. The mass is initially located at x = 0 when the spring is unstretched (equilibrium position). You pull the mass away from the equilibrium position, out to x = A, and then release it. The mass then oscillates horizontally back and forth in simple harmonic motion. Which of the statements below are true about this motion?

conceptgroup.p: The magnitude of the acceleration of the mass is maximum at x = A
The magnitude of the acceleration of the mass is maximum at x = 0
The magnitude of the acceleration of the mass is maximum at x = -A
The magnitude of the acceleration of the mass is maximum at x = A/2
The speed of the mass is maximum at x = A
The speed of the mass is maximum at x = 0
The speed of the mass is maximum at x = -A
The speed of the mass is maximum at x = A/2
The potential energy of the mass-spring system is maximum at x = A
The potential energy of the mass-spring system is maximum at x = 0
The potential energy of the mass-spring system is maximum at x = -A
The potential energy of the mass-spring system is maximum at x = A/2
The total energy of the mass-spring system at x = A is the same as the total energy at x = 0
The total energy of the mass-spring system at x = A is the same as the total energy at x = -A
The total energy of the mass-spring system at x = A is the same as the total energy at x = A/2
The total energy of the mass-spring system at x = A is the same as the total energy at any value of x
The amplitude (A) is defined as the maximum displacement of the mass (i.e. greatest distance from the equilibrium point)
The period (T) is defined as the time required to complete one cycle
The frequency (f) is defined as the number of complete cycles per second
Simple harmonic motion can also be referred to as periodic motion
